title: 103_hr2040
content: The Act may be cited as the "Commission on the Dual-Use Application of Facilities and Resources at White Sands Missile Range Act". Congress finds that the end of the Cold War allows for a reduction in defense spending, creating an opportunity to utilize defense-related technology in the private sector for economic growth and job creation. The Department of Defense has invested billions in research and development in this area. The Department of Defense has not adequately studied or provided guidance for the utilization of defense-related facilities, equipment, processes, and technologies by the private sector. A study of White Sands Missile Range offers an opportunity to examine these defense-related resources and their use by scientific personnel. Establishing a commission to study these resources will be beneficial. The utilization of defense-related facilities, equipment, processes, and technologies by the private sector will be studied to provide information on potential dual-use applications. Establishment of Commission. Establishment of Commission on the Dual-Use Application of Facilities and Resources at White Sands Missile Range, composed of 10 members appointed by the Secretary of Defense, including individuals familiar with cooperative research and development agreements and dual-use technologies. The Commission on the Dual-Use Application of Facilities and Resources at White Sands Missile Range is composed of 10 members appointed by the Secretary of Defense. Members must have experience in high technology research, development, and commercial utilization. They serve for the life of the Commission, with vacancies filled in the same manner as the original appointment. Six members constitute a quorum, and the Commission selects a Chairman from among its members. The Commission on the Dual-Use Application of Facilities and Resources at White Sands Missile Range is composed of 10 members appointed by the Secretary of Defense. They select a Chairman from among themselves. The Commission must hold its first meeting within 30 days of all members being appointed and will terminate one year after all members are appointed. Meetings are called by the Chairman. The Commission at White Sands Missile Range will study how defense-related resources can be used by the private sector and submit a report to Congress within a year. They have the power to make recommendations for legislation and administrative actions. The Commission has the authority to hold hearings, gather information from federal agencies, delegate powers among its members, and use the postal service as needed. The Commission has the authority to operate like other US departments and agencies. SEC. 6. COMMISSION PERSONNEL MATTERS. Each member of the Commission, not an officer or employee of the US, will be compensated at a rate set by the Commission. Those who are officers or employees of the US will not receive additional compensation. Members will also receive travel expenses while away from their homes for Commission duties. The Commission appoints an executive director with a set compensation rate. The director can hire additional personnel as needed. Service on the Commission or employment by the Commission does not count towards other provisions. Service on the Commission or employment by the Commission does not count towards other provisions regarding conflicts of interest or restrictions related to federal law. Authorization of appropriations is granted to carry out the purposes of this Act.
